pages.text: I assume you want to stay prepared for the elements out there, so here's some simple clothing and armor recipes. Armor can be crafted from most materials, ranging from Rose Gold to Planks or even Turtle Scutes.

pages.title: Garments
pages.text: Decent protection for under armor.

pages.title: Femme Garments
pages.text: Less covering, but a different variant.

pages.title: Masc Garments
pages.text: The least covering, but yet another variant.

pages.title: Chef Apron
pages.text: Good for working in the kitchen.

pages.title: Chef Toque
pages.text: The most emblematic part of any Chef's uniform.

pages.title: Straw Hat
pages.text: Great for those warm sunny days.

pages.title: Cowpoke Hat
pages.text: Whether herding cows or running from boulders, it's a great fashion statement.

pages.title: Hunter's Hat
pages.text: Partaking in a Night of the Hunt? Good luck then.

pages.title: Leather Necklace
pages.text: Usually smithed with a trinket into a Talisman or Keepsake.

pages.title: Iron Necklace
pages.text: Smithed with gems into an Amulet.

pages.title: Brasium Goggles
pages.text: Commonly worn by Brasiumpunkers and Airship Pilots.

pages.title: Warm Boots
pages.text: Great for traveling over Powdered Snow.

pages.title: Feather Hairpin
pages.text: I think Crow Feathers make for most elegant Hairpins, but I'm no fashion expert.

pages.title: Helmets & Hoods
pages.text: Good protection against undead Skeleton Archers. They always aim for the head.

pages.title: Masked Helmets & Hoods
pages.text: For a stealthy and secretive approach.

pages.title: Breastplates
pages.text: Lighter than a Chestplate, but less protective.

pages.title: Chestplates
pages.text: Heavy but protective.

pages.title: Leggings
pages.text: Protective, but likewise the heaviest option.

pages.title: Hauberks
pages.text: Somewhere between a Skirt and a Kilt, but better.

pages.title: Thigh Guards
pages.text: The least heavy option, but also the least protective.

pages.title: Boots
pages.text: Simple but protective. Boots made from leather can help you walk on top of snow, too.

pages.title: Sandals
pages.text: Great for deserts or beaches.
